title: One of the five Central Park exonerees soon to be a member of New York City Council
description: Yusef Salaam had been wrongly sentenced, along with four other teenagers, to a long prison term for the rape of a young woman in 1989. The four young African Americans and one Hispanic were cleared in 2002. The 49-year-old won the Democratic primary on Wednesday and is expected to join the New York City Council in the fall.

title: Mexico City's "anti-monuments" movement: a protest against oblivion
description: With installations in emblematic locations throughout the Mexican capital, families protest the "inaction of the state" in the face of the fate of their loved ones, missing or victims of crime.

title: Dutch PM resigns, government collapses after coalition fails to agree on migration policy
description: The ruling coalition had tried for months to decide on a new deal to reduce the number of migrants arriving in the country. Dutch media reports new elections will likely be held around the middle of November.

title: Washington says to provide Ukraine with cluster munitions
description: The decision comes on the eve of a NATO summit in Lithuania. The cluster munitions are included in a new $800 million package of military aid Washington will send to Ukraine.

title: Texas gunman in 2019 Walmart shooting gets 90 consecutive life sentences
description: Patrick Crusius, 24, pleaded guilty earlier this year to nearly 50 federal hate crime charges in the 2019 mass shooting in El Paso, Texas

title: France's Amandine Henry ruled out of World Cup because of calf injury
description: Defender Aïssatou Tounkara was summoned on Friday to join the 23-women France squad as a replacement.

title: NATO leaders set to offer Kyiv major support package
description: NATO leaders are to meet in Vilnius, Lithuania, next week to discuss the situation in Ukraine. But the war-torn country will not start membership talks soon.

title: Philipsen denies Cavendish Tour stage record in dramatic sprint
description: The 38-year-old Cavendish appeared to be about to bag a record-breaking 35th career stage win on the Tour de France when he took the lead, but Philipsen then burst back past him to win by a bike length at the line.

title: Riots in France: Key lessons from social, political and educational crisis
description: The violence over the last week in France is rooted in known but unresolved structural problems.

title: War in Ukraine: On the front line with gunners
description: In Ukraine's Zaporizhia region, the unit led by Commander 'Gall' has learned to cobble together rocket launchers for want of sufficient equipment. Kyiv's counteroffensive struggles to achieve progress in the face of 'never-stopping' Russian forces.

title: Eurovision: Swedish city of Malmo will host music contest in 2024
description: The southern Swedish city also hosted the event in 2012, when singer Loreen won for the first time. She came out on top again in the 2023 edition with her song 'Tattoo.'

title: Climate: Maritime sector raises decarbonization targets
description: Member countries of the International Maritime Organization have adopted a target of zero net emissions 'by or around 2050.' Environmental groups say it is not enough.

title: Kylian Mbappé welcomed as superstar in father's native Cameroon
description: The French footballer is on a three-day visit to the country. The program includes school visits, a meeting with the prime minister and a gala match.

title: Sub-Saharan migrants are subject to mounting hostility in North Africa
description: The ethnic hatred unleashed on the Tunisian town of Sfax demonstrates the trap that is closing in on would-be exiles from sub-Saharan countries, caught between the lockdown of 'Fortress Europe' and the racism of North African societies.

title: Despite the riots, French hotels are looking forward to a a buoyant summer season
description: Despite cancellations in some luxury establishments, the French tourism sector remains confident.

title: War in Ukraine: Tensions at Kyiv's Lavra caves, the epicenter of religious discord
description: The Ukrainian authorities are struggling to reclaim the country's most sacred religious site, which they accuse of still being linked to the Moscow Patriarchate.

title: Riots in France: Cultural venues suffered damage across country
description: Among other public facilities, libraries, theaters and cinemas were damaged during the violence that followed the death of Nahel M.

title: Myanmar: French asset managers offer investments in companies that sell arms to military junta
description: Crédit Agricole et Axa allow investors to invest their money in Chinese and Indian companies that supply trucks, combat aircraft or remote-controlled firing posts to the dictatorship, which is subject to a European arms embargo.

title: French skipper Escoffier under investigation over sexual violence accusations
description: Kevin Escoffier was accused of sexual assault during the Ocean Race in May by a female crew member.

title: Riots in France: The right's worrying drift
description: In the wake of the riots following the death of Nahel M., the leaders of the right-wing Les Républicains party have chosen to defend the same ideas as the far right.

title: Riots in France: Journalists face physical threats while reporting on unrest
description: Christophe Deloire, the head of Reporters Without Borders, is concerned that violence against journalists is becoming 'less and less unusual,' citing precedents during the 2019 Yellow Vest movement or the 2021 anti-vaccine pass protests.

title: Macky Sall: 'Senegal may be shaken, but it will withstand'
description: After months of suspense, Senegal's president announced that he will not run in the February 2024 presidential election. In an exclusive interview with Le Monde, he explains his decision.

title: Arrests made in anti-terrorist sting in Germany and the Netherlands
description: Nine people from Central Asia in contact with members of the Islamic State in Khorasan (IS-K), the group's active branch in Afghanistan, have been arrested.

title: More than 450 charged in UK's major month-long cannabis operation
description: Hundreds of thousands of cannabis plants worth millions of pounds were seized throughout June in Operation Mille.

title: China bans some Japanese food imports over Fukushima water release
description: Beijing's customs authority on Friday said it would ban food imports from 10 Japanese prefectures over Tokyo's plan to release treated nuclear wastewater into the ocean. The release is expected to begin this summer but is opposed by some regional neighbors.

title: Lawyer of Nahel M.'s family: 'There is no police problem in France, there is a judicial problem'
description: Yassine Bouzrou, who specializes in defending victims of police violence, believes that the justice system 'blatantly' protects officers, fostering a sense of impunity.

title: The Leclerc tank gets a facelift
description: 200 units will need to be modernized between now and 2029. For some experts, however, the planned 'retrofit' is insufficient in view of the lessons learned from the war in Ukraine.

title: US grants full approval to new Alzheimer's medicine
description: Leqembi was shown in a clinical trial to modestly reduce cognitive decline among patients in the early stages of the disease. But the study also raised concerns about side effects including brain bleeds and swelling.

title: In Mozambique, TotalEnergies is ready to relaunch its gas megaproject despite the jihadist threat
description: The French group, which had suspended its activities after an attack, is being criticized by NGOs for the high greenhouse gas emissions of the future LNG plant.
